entry.title: Test Writing Tips: Part 2
entry.content:
Here are the “Last Five” of the Top Ten Test Writing Tips that may help you to write a stronger exam!

  • Start with a question for which you know the answer. You do not have to start at the beginning of the test. Knowing the answer to the first question you try builds your confidence and sets a positive tone for the rest of the exam.
  • Look for clues and information in one part of the test that helps you to answer questions in another part. Useful information is often included in diagrams, charts, graphs, photos, and source information such as the year a photo was taken or where the author lived. Pictures, charts, graphs, and diagrams may provide a context for the question you are expected to answer.
  • Answer every question even if you have to guess. Leaving a question blank is guaranteed to earn you zero marks. An educated guess in a multiple choice question gives you an opportunity to ‘luck out’.
  • Read over all of your answers before you hand in your test. You want to be sure you’ve answered all the questions, that your response satisfies what was asked, and that your calculations are accurate. Where necessary include the units of measurement.
  • Finish your answers to written response or essay questions in point form if you are running out of time. This shows the marker that you have understood the question and have an organized and thoughtful response – just not enough time for complete sentences.

When writing an exam, there is no substitute for knowing your course material really well but you can bolster your performance by staying in the exam room for the entire amount of time and reviewing your answers. Take a short ‘mental break’ by rolling your head from side to side and/or shrugging your shoulders. In thinking about the overall test or reviewing specific questions, you may remember additional information to add to some of your written responses or help you with the multiple choice questions.

If you are serious about your success on the diploma exams – DIPLOMAX is here to help you succeed!
